design_class.name: Aldeburgh O D or Alde Class

for_sales.sales_text:
Naiad has belonged to us for 40 years. She was built in the 1930s by Eversons boatyard in Woodbridge. I believe that about 30 were built and Naiad is one of very few remaining. She has been used for sailing the Stour estuary with all our family and was stored in a barn at home during the winter. When we first owned her I gave her a new top strake and a marine ply deck covered with a layer of glassfibre cloth which has lasted well with no problems. The International Boat Building Training College in Lowestoft replaced various planks and frames about ten years ago.

She was on her mooring at Manningtree each summer until two years ago, with a new Elite cover protecting her brightwork from the elements. Naiad has a galvanised iron centreplate and a short bowsprit. Her jib is furled using an original Wykeham Martin furling system. She is gunter rigged. Naiad is for sale to a good home for just £1,200.

There is an electric EPropulsion outboardmotor available by separate negotiation

boat.name: Naiad
boat.short_description: Naiad was built in the 1930s by Everson and Sons in Woodbridge. About 30 were built and Naiad is one of very few remaining. She has been used for sailing the Stour estuary.
